story:
Ignite the Fire

Founded in 2011 by Artistic Director Nela H, diskordanse is a professional contemporary dance company out of South Surrey, British Columbia, Canada. At the heart of diskordanse is original movement, unbridled vision, and the symbiotic marriage of dance and film. We aspire to make you feel and to have you experience a moment that leaves you questioning, leaves you searching, leaves you stunned.

diskordanse received critical acclaim for its first piece DISLOKATION. Presented in three separate layers between 2011 and 2013, DISLOKATION took the audience through a journey of boundaries both created and transcended. Edgy, gritty, and entirely original, our audience was left looking over shoulders as they assimilated in to the final act.


2013 finds diskoranse at the birth of a new production and we need your help to ignite the fire. We are honoured to present ARIA, an original creation by Nela H. ARIA will tour Lower Mainland theatres in the Spring of 2014 and diskordanse is seeking sponsors and donors to help cover the costs of production. This initial phase of funding aims to raise $20,000 for immediate theatre and equipment rentals, original music, technical and SOCAN fees and a small contribution to our dancers and choreographer for their time and expenses. For the entire production, we hope to raise $60,000.

Every little bit makes a huge impact and no donation is too small.

Every fire needs a spark. 

Sponsorships and Donations

DONATIONS
diskordanse is honoured to accept donations in all amounts. Your generosity keeps us strong. Thank you for your support.

SPONSORSHIPS
diskordanse also offers sponsorship packages for preset funding levels. If you are selecting a sponsorship, please contact Savannah at savannah@diskordanse.ca following your gracious contribution.

Sweet Category ($500)
Perks: Name listing in production programs and 2 complimentary tickets for the opening performance.

Smooth Category ($1000-$1,500)
Perks: Logo placement on sponsorship page of production programs and on all marketing materials (posters, ads, etc). Access to select, private "behind the scenes" events, 2 complimentary tickets for the opening performance and use of the diskordanse logo on your corporate website.

Edgy Category ($2,000-$2,500)
Perks: Logo placement on all event signage and on all marketing materials (posters, ads, etc). Access to all private "behind the scenes" events, 2 complimentary tickets for the opening performance, use of the diskordanse logo on your corporate website, and a 1/4-page ad in each production program.

Awesome Category ($3,000+)
Perks: Premiere logo placement on all event signage, all marketing materials (posters, ads, etc), and on the cover of the production programs. Access to all private "behind the scenes" events, 4 complimentary tickets for the opening performance, use of the diskordanse logo on your corporate website, and a half-page ad in each production program.

Title Sponsorship ($10,000+)
diskordanse is ready to discuss the details of a title sponsorship, keeping in mind the specific needs of your organization. All partnerships include opportunities to market your organization in the theatre lobbies and other special opportunities to be created as part of a uniquely tailored package to meet your needs.

[Heart] diskordanse

We realize that not everyone is in a position to help us financially. You can still help support diskordanse by spreading the word. If you know of an individual or company with an interest in the arts, dance, or the community, please direct them to our campaign here at Indiegogo! More information can also be found on the web:

  • www.diskordanse.ca
  • https://twitter.com/diskordanse
  • https://www.facebook.com/diskordanse
  • http://www.youtube.com/user/ThediskordanseCo
story_txt:
Ignite the Fire
Founded in 2011 by Artistic Director Nela H, diskordanse is a professional contemporary dance company out of South Surrey, British Columbia, Canada. At the heart of diskordanse is original movement, unbridled vision, and the symbiotic marriage of dance and film. We aspire to make you feel and to have you experience a moment that leaves you questioning, leaves you searching, leaves you stunned.diskordanse received critical acclaim for its first piece DISLOKATION. Presented in three separate layers between 2011 and 2013, DISLOKATION took the audience through a journey of boundaries both created and transcended. Edgy, gritty, and entirely original, our audience was left looking over shoulders as they assimilated in to the final act.
2013 finds diskoranse at the birth of a new production and we need your help to ignite the fire. We are honoured to present ARIA, an original creation by Nela H. ARIA will tour Lower Mainland theatres in the Spring of 2014 and diskordanse is seeking sponsors and donors to help cover the costs of production. This initial phase of funding aims to raise $20,000 for immediate theatre and equipment rentals, original music, technical and SOCAN fees and a small contribution to our dancers and choreographer for their time and expenses. For the entire production, we hope to raise $60,000.Every little bit makes a huge impact and no donation is too small.Every fire needs a spark. Sponsorships and Donations
DONATIONSdiskordanse is honoured to accept donations in all amounts. Your generosity keeps us strong. Thank you for your support.SPONSORSHIPSdiskordanse also offers sponsorship packages for preset funding levels. If you are selecting a sponsorship, please contact Savannah at savannah@diskordanse.ca following your gracious contribution.Sweet Category ($500)Perks: Name listing in production programs and 2 complimentary tickets for the opening performance.Smooth Category ($1000-$1,500)Perks: Logo placement on sponsorship page of production programs and on all marketing materials (posters, ads, etc). Access to select, private "behind the scenes" events, 2 complimentary tickets for the opening performance and use of the diskordanse logo on your corporate website.Edgy Category ($2,000-$2,500)Perks: Logo placement on all event signage and on all marketing materials (posters, ads, etc). Access to all private "behind the scenes" events, 2 complimentary tickets for the opening performance, use of the diskordanse logo on your corporate website, and a 1/4-page ad in each production program.Awesome Category ($3,000+)Perks: Premiere logo placement on all event signage, all marketing materials (posters, ads, etc), and on the cover of the production programs. Access to all private "behind the scenes" events, 4 complimentary tickets for the opening performance, use of the diskordanse logo on your corporate website, and a half-page ad in each production program.Title Sponsorship ($10,000+)diskordanse is ready to discuss the details of a title sponsorship, keeping in mind the specific needs of your organization. All partnerships include opportunities to market your organization in the theatre lobbies and other special opportunities to be created as part of a uniquely tailored package to meet your needs.
[Heart] diskordanse
We realize that not everyone is in a position to help us financially. You can still help support diskordanse by spreading the word. If you know of an individual or company with an interest in the arts, dance, or the community, please direct them to our campaign here at Indiegogo! More information can also be found on the web:

story:
The Beach of Joseph K.

Opening March, 2015 at La Mama ETC. NYC, NY.

The Story:

The despair/hopelessness, the loneliness, the absurd and the nonsense of human existence are the themes that weave and make up the background of this project. The beach that Joseph “K” imagines before waking up and walking into the nightmare of The Process is another nightmare filled with absurd, grotesque, vulgar, violent and even erotic realities.

The characters of The Beach are all antiheroes, subjected to an invisible power that works effectively to make them fully comply with the laws and obey orders. Nobody doubts The Power, it doesn’t matter who makes the law or who imposes it; it is there to be followed! Joseph “K” is the main character in the play. He is a very egocentric and individualist character. He was arrested for no apparent reason, and is about to be informed of the extent of his punishment: life in prison or the death sentence.  

Joseph “K” is considered by the characters on the beach to be a dangerous and despicable person. He wants to know the reason(s) why he was arrested; this is where his process begins, and he knows it won’t bring any results. 

The rest of the characters think that Joseph must be judged without mercy, to the full extent of the law. As he realizes that all of his roads/options have come to an end, his downfall begins irreversibly. “K” begins to live different situations, escaping from reality. There is a door to which access is denied to him, even though it is the door that can help him solve his problems. 

Access to The Law has been denied to him time and time again. All his actions are being observed by the beach goers. “K” thinks he has everyone’s attention, when in reality he is actually being judged by them. He loses strength and hope as he tries to make his case. 

He finds a lawyer and his assistants, and although it appears the lawyer may be able to help him, “K” realizes the lawyer too has to submit and is controlled by The Law. His name is spoken, his conviction announced. The beach goers block his path and force him to make his choice. Joseph accepts the verdict of the jury: the death sentence. 

The law must punish him because at some point, maybe when he wasn’t aware of it, he broke the law and deserves to be punished. The jury gives him the option to commit suicide. At first, Joseph decides to go ahead with the suicide; he must drown in the sea. 

Just when “K” is about to drown, he changes his mind and tries to escape, but the beach goers stop him, arrest him, he is condemned and hanged. 

The beach goers bury him in the sand and all the characters go back to their routine activities, waiting for the next person to be condemned. In the dark.  

The Team:

Elia K. Schneider, Founder and Artistic Director of Teatro Dramma. Four times “Official Selection for the Academy Awards" her latest film" Punto y Raya"(Venezuela-Spain-Uruguay-Chile 2005) won 30 awards including ( Los Angeles, Huelva, Santo Domingo, Biarritz, Bogota, Gramado, Sao Paolo, Santa Barbara, San Francisco, Montreal, La Habana etc) . Her film " Desautorizados" (Un-authorized) was nominated for the Golden Globet Award in the Shanghai Film Festival (2010) Has been a writer, producer, casting director and director since 1980. Founder of " Joel Films" and produced " Sicario" (27 international awards including Tokyo, Huelva, La Habana, Santa Barbara, Oro Diablo (10 international awards) and " El Don". Her film " Huelepega (Glue Sniffer) 2000 was censored by the Venezuelan authorities during President Caldera's period and than released in Venezuela with the highest gross of the year in box office.

Elia is known for her hauntingly visual productions, which transcend language barrier with strong visual imagery and dreamlike fresco of movement and design.
She first graduated in Psychology in the Universidad Catolica Andres Bello in Caracas and than admitted to the MFA program in New York University Tisch School of the Arts (Theater Directing) where she studied with Carl Weber, Mel Shapiro, Marshall Mason, Olimpia Dukakis, Ronni Davies, Kevin Kline, Zelda Fitzgerald and than graduated in 1982.

New York City, 1986

Mrs. Schneider has also been an award winner theatre writer director of several plays based on Kafka all staged in " La Mama etc" New York since 1982 like " A Peticion del Publico"(Wunskonzert) "Blumfeld" " Gaz" " Stasis" " Rooms" " The Lesson" " Emigrants" Her plays received favorable critical notice of The New York Times, Village Voice, Daily News.

Her production Gaz was a part of the worldwide commemoration of the 50th Anniversary of the Holocaust in 1989.Schneider, who envisioned " Request Concert" naturalistically, divided the play's solo character into two versions of herself played by two different actresses in whiteface. The production was a stark contrast to Joanne Akalitis photorealistic staging of the play two years before and, to some critics, a superior journey into the play inner life. The New YorkTimes ( Mell Gussow) asserted that, by vindicating the abstract approach to this play, Ms. Schneider had helped establish the work as a classic. " Blumfeld" earned accolades for Schneider for a " troubling, startling and beautiful meditation on loneliness (Laurie Stone, Village Voice). Critiques raised provocative issues on how the essence of Kafka 's writing could rightfully be adapted for the stage. In an article whose headline called the play "beyond Kafka" Steven Hart (Villager) observed, " Kafka was a master of finding the subtleties that lie beneath the endless banality of most human relations, and these undercurrents are what Teatro Dramma seems to be exploiting in Blumfeld. He analyzed the play as " an exploration of the atmospheric conditions the story produces in the reader " an approach that could have been taken from the director's notes of Schneider current play. D. J. Bruckner of The New York Times (2000) said about "Rooms" " it is such a triumphant moment of theater that it brings cries of admiration and thunder of hands from the audience"

Mrs. Schneider has been coaching and teaching actors since 1980. Led workshops based on Stanislavsky, Adler, Meisner in Latin America, and Los Angeles at Stella Adler Academy of Acting. Is currently preparing pre-production for her new project " Tamara" and is directing a new project for La Mama etc. in 2014.

JOSEPH NOVOA is a Film Director- Producer -Writer, has been Teatro Dramma's

advisor and Lighting Designer since the foundation of this theatre company (1982) He is a 3 times Official Selection for Venezuela for the Academy Awards. Won a nomination for the Goya Awards and 80 awards in International Film Festivals including Tokyo, Santa Barbara, Philadelphia, FT Lauderdale Huelva, La Habana, Trieste, Gramado etc. Produced 18 feature films in Spain, Argentina, Uruguay and Venezuela and is considered one of the most important Film Director and Producer of the Ibero-American region. Directed films as "Agony" "Sicario", "Devil's Gold", The Boss", "A Distant Place" and "Alone".

Mr Novoa's lighting design received accolates from important Newspapers such as the New York Times

"He is a Filmmaker who makes ROOMS shine, brooding boxes Fritz Lang would have loved".Mr Novoa has a film degree from New York University and TV Degree from Global Village (New School-NY). He studied theatre with french professor Jacques Lecoq (France) and Eugenio Barba (Odin Teatret)(Danmark) . He also was Deputy Director of two prestigious International Theatre Festivals in Venezuela. His theatre credits include "Masques" "La Noche de los Asesinos" "L'exile du Soleil". Wrote many screenplays.

story:
Shakespeare for Everyone!

Residents of all ages and economic backgrounds are invited to come together for free outdoor theater in Vallejo, Martinez and Oakland. We are passionate about  presenting high quality professional theater and introducing non-theater goers to the exciting experience of watching a live outdoor performance. Because this is a free event, all funds to pay company members and operations must be raised through grants and other fund raising sources such as asking generous community members like you to contribute to this campaign. 


Your contribution will go directly to paying our fabulous and well deserving Actors, Director and Stage Manager! 

Matinee performances, using natural light and sound, means we will not use or need lighting and sound equipment or techs, keeping our production costs low and our performance values high! Still, we need $3190 to cover our actors', stage manager and director's pay for our upcoming free performances. 

Then, why, you ask, are we asking for the odd $3190? Fees. Up to 10%. Indiegogo (4%), plus paypal and credit card fees (3% ea). In order for us to get the full $2900 we need to pay our 15 actors and one stage manager $150 each, and our director  $500, we need to include the additional cost for these fees.


A free community event.

Vallejo Shakespeare in the Park is in our sixth season, presenting MACBETH. Once again our production will be directed by Clinton Vidal. Performances will be held at the Hanns Park Amphitheater in Vallejo July 25 and 26, at the Martinez Waterfront Amphitheater in Martinez, August 1 and 2, and the Peralta Hacienda Historical Park in Oakland on August 8 and 9, 2015. All performances at 3 pm.

Our 2015 show will be another “bare-bones” production, concentrating on the actors performances, with minimal set and modern dress. 

Vallejo Shakespeare in the Park is proud to bring professional live theater to the residents of Vallejo, Martinez and Oakland. Our aim is to provide an inspiring and educational experience for our audience through intensive preparation and high quality performance.  

Find us on Facebook at www.facebook.com/VallejoShakespeareinthePark.  

Performance opportunities for the Bay Area theater community!

One of our goals is to provide professional performance opportunities through non-traditional casting to Bay Area actors of color and varying backgrounds. Our casts are made up of multi-ethnic and diverse actors from around the Bay Area. Characters in the plays are often switched from male to female, as well as casting females to play male roles, providing more acting opportunities for women. Smaller roles are also given to novice actors to give opportunities to a wide range of actors at every level. We want our productions to reflect our diverse community where we perform and help our audience connect to classical theater with exciting contemporary staging.

We pay our fantastic actors a small stipend for their hard work and time, but we need help to do this. Please help. Thank you.

All photos are from our 2014 production of A Midsummer Night's Dream. Photos taken by Clinton Vidal and Dede Scrivner.

story:
Help us put on this show!

Students at Santa Clara High School have been begging their teacher to let them choose a dramatic show for the Spring Musical and this year he's given them a deal; Next to Normal in the Fall if they can raise the money on time.

For a lot of us, this show has been an inspiration and helped us find our passion in theatre. To be able to actually perform this show would be the dream and opportunity of a lifetime, not to mention a chance to expand our range as actors.

So, in the mood to help some young aspiring actors?

 

Where's All this Money Going?

Every cent of that $1,500 will be going to purchasing the rights to even perform the show. We already have the SCHS theater reserved and things like costumes and set will be donated from parents or recycled from previous shows.

We'll offer tickets to the show to anyone who donates $3 or more. We'll also offer video recordings of any song of your choice from Next to Normal, bows,  and any donation will get you a shoutout in our program letting everyone else know what a saint you are for helping us!

In the unfortunate event that we don't reach our goal in time combined with what we might earn in physical donations, the profits from this campaign will be going towards our Spring Musical How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying. We already have money set aside for the rights of that show, but unfortunately, we need $4,000 just to use the pit in our theater.

The Impact

If this were to pull through, it would mean the world to everyone involved; the actors, musicians, conductor, even our teacher. The chance to do a musical of this extremely high calibur is such an honor and will probably be the most valuable experience any of us will have as actors in our high school career.

This is our first time raising money for a show because of recent budget cuts, but we will all work our butts off to do this show!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone interested may be able to donate, but please spread the word and help make the people around you aware of our cause. You might just make a new friend based off a newfound mutual interest!

Please help make our dream come true!

story:
Our Bloody Tale!

The Crown and Scepter Theater Company is a brand new Columbia student-run theatre organization not yet recognized by the university. This is our first semester and first production. It is a company made of a lot of heart and an unending enthusiasm for bringing great theatre to Columbia students and the greater New York area. The group is very diverse in artistic talent and brings a fresh vibe to the entire Columbia Community. The company also volunteers its time with Columbia’s Double Discovery Center providing arts based workshops to some of its middle and high school students.


We Have the BEST Pies in London!

Sweeney Todd is a masterwork of American musical theater, a tragicomic free-for-all of blood, guts, laughs, love, lust, greed and sorrow, all told in the dark tones of Stephen Sondheim’s London. Sweeney Todd describes it best when he intones “There's a hole in the world like a great black pit/ And the vermin of the world inhabit it/ And its morals aren't worth what a pig could spit/ And it goes by the name of London.” We want to show you that place, not because it is exotic, but because iniquity abounds in all cities, not least in New York, and what we see in Sweeney we also see to one extent or another in our own lives. For the fan of Shakespeare and the Greeks, the character of Sweeney Todd is a tragic hero, sympathetic to start but who twists and warps into someone altogether different as the show progresses; a maniacal beast who gets his final comeuppance when he learns the true fate of his wife. For the fan of spectacle, there is no shortage of that here. From the moment Sweeney Todd has his first taste of blood, slitting the fraud Pirelli’s throat and stuffing his still writhing body into a wooden chest, he cannot stop his horrible, incessant need to kill. The audience will be treated to meat pies made of priests, lines of dying customers, and lots of bloody, bloody business. The Crows and Sceptor Theater Company presents to you a cast of top-notch performers from Columbia University, a full orchestra hailing from The Juilliard School to Hofstra to Columbia University, directed by Joseph Rozenshtein and conducted by Mitchell Feinberg. So without further ado, we invite you to “Attend the tale of Sweeney Todd”!


Thruppence for a Meat Pie, More for Other Goodies

As a new group, funding is a difficult arena for us and we could really use your support to put on the best show we can! But your support will not go unnoticed:


All donations over $20 will get a name in program!


A donation of $10 will get you a Sweeney Todd poster signed by the cast!
A donation of $15 gets you a copy of the Cast Photo!

A donation of $35 gets you a VIP ticket to the show!


All donations over $50 will get a name in the program AND a poster!

But Wait, There's More!

Spread the word! Let people know about our show and our organization. And please come see the amazing talent that has come together to produce this fantastic incarnation of a classic musical thriller!

It is a company made of a lot of heart and an unending enthusiasm for bringing great theatre to Columbia students and the greater New York area. The group is very diverse in artistic talent and brings a fresh vibe to the entire Columbia Community. The company also volunteers its time with Columbia’s Double Discovery Center providing arts based workshops to some of its middle and high school students.




We Have the BEST Pies in London!


Sweeney Todd is a masterwork of American musical theater, a tragicomic free-for-all of blood, guts, laughs, love, lust, greed and sorrow, all told in the dark tones of Stephen Sondheim’s London. Sweeney Todd describes it best when he intones “There's a hole in the world like a great black pit/ And the vermin of the world inhabit it/ And its morals aren't worth what a pig could spit/ And it goes by the name of London.” We want to show you that place, not because it is exotic, but because iniquity abounds in all cities, not least in New York, and what we see in Sweeney we also see to one extent or another in our own lives. For the fan of Shakespeare and the Greeks, the character of Sweeney Todd is a tragic hero, sympathetic to start but who twists and warps into someone altogether different as the show progresses; a maniacal beast who gets his final comeuppance when he learns the true fate of his wife. For the fan of spectacle, there is no shortage of that here. From the moment Sweeney Todd has his first taste of blood, slitting the fraud Pirelli’s throat and stuffing his still writhing body into a wooden chest, he cannot stop his horrible, incessant need to kill. The audience will be treated to meat pies made of priests, lines of dying customers, and lots of bloody, bloody business. The Crows and Sceptor Theater Company presents to you a cast of top-notch performers from Columbia University, a full orchestra hailing from The Juilliard School to Hofstra to Columbia University, directed by Joseph Rozenshtein and conducted by Mitchell Feinberg. So without further ado, we invite you to “Attend the tale of Sweeney Todd”!




Thruppence for a Meat Pie, More for Other Goodies
As a new group, funding is a difficult arena for us and we could really use your support to put on the best show we can! But your support will not go unnoticed:

All donations over $20 will get a name in program!

A donation of $10 will get you a Sweeney Todd poster signed by the cast!A donation of $15 gets you a copy of the Cast Photo!
A donation of $35 gets you a VIP ticket to the show!

All donations over $50 will get a name in the program AND a poster!

But Wait, There's More!
Spread the word! Let people know about our show and our organization. And please come see the amazing talent that has come together to produce this fantastic incarnation of a classic musical thriller!

story:
The Play

The Boy in the Church is a modernized retelling of The Hunchback of Notre Dame that takes place in the Great-Depression-era, deep south. This play critically analyzes the race relations of the time, while also drawing parallels to our most pressing, contemporary issues. The story follows aspiring writer, Peter Gorenstein, through his journey into small-town Alabama, where he meets the shadowy figures of the Sheriff and the Reverend, a beautiful African-American dancer named Estelle, and Q, the rumored “boy in the church.” The text raises the question of how much has really changed in the last 75 years?  

We need your help! 

We are proud that show had impact enough to be asked to return to the stage. To ensure that the production meets its full potential, we are asking for donations to contribute to the overall production budget. Due to the nature of a tour, not only will fundraising efforts contribute to sets, costumes, and promotional materials, but in addition each donation will offset hotels and transportation.  Even a little can go a long way, and each cent is appreciated.

We are proud that show had impact enough to be asked to return to the stage. To ensure that the production meets its full potential, we are asking for donations to contribute to the overall production budget. Due to the nature of a tour, not only will fundraising efforts contribute to sets, costumes, and promotional materials, but in addition each donation will offset hotels and transportation.  Even a little can go a long way, and each cent is appreciated.

story:
All About Us!!!

We are a small theatre company with a great product! Great Expectations is our latest adaptation and it went down a storm in theatres and arts centres in the UK and Ireland last Autumn. Now we want to tour it again this spring. We have the tour booked and the play cast but we need funding to help cover our staggering production costs! Touring is an expensive business. Fuel and accommodation are not cheap. Things go wrong on tours; cars break down (twice), computers get run over (yes that happened too), actors get ill (and need replacing with less than 24 hours notice). All of these things happened last autumn and our contingency fund was not deep enough to cover it. We took a big hit. This spring we need the tour to work (which it will with a little support ) in order to get back on our feet and take the company to new heights!

PS the contributions are in dollars purely because that's the only currency this website deals in. You give and we will receive the sterling equivalent at the current rate of exchange

The Impact

This production is both a milestone and a watershed for Hotbuckle as a company . It is commercially extremely viable and is a veritable hit with audiences but if we don't succeed in making this tour happen the company will inevitably fold. 


What We Need & What You Get

We need help with our travel and accommodation costs. We also need a float to cover our contingency costs - the things that go wrong

You get perks, PERKS, PERKS!  see stage right


Other Ways You Can Help

Help us by spreading the word. Little amounts from a lot of people will make a massive difference to us and help ensure that we take this great production to a lot of people. ( Don't forget  the share tools!)
